testcase.brief: Forward all traffic via tunnel by default
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition:
-config a remote CVG, there is several LANs behind it -there are some services in CVG's LANs -BR setup VPN connection with the CVG -setup all wifi radios and eth interfaces as access mode -bind user-profile with l3-tunnel-action all on both wifi radio and wired eth interfaces
Test Procedure:
-check the ip policy-route l3-tunnel-all -STA1 ping web server on internet -STA1 ping servers behind remote CVG -STA1 ping local LANs

step.desc: enable wan port nat if FW nonexists
config mgt0.1 with dhcp service enable
step.telnet: -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server enable"

step.desc: config mgt0.2 with dhcp service enable
step.telnet: -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.2 dhcp-server enable"

step.multi-setvar: echo "br1.br.mgt0.1.route=$(echo ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "br1.br.mgt0.2.route=$(echo ${br1.br.mgt0.2.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "cvg1.dns1.route=$(echo ${cvg1.dns1.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "cvg1.dns2.route=$(echo ${cvg1.dns2.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0" echo "cvg1.vpc1.route=$(echo ${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip} | cut -d. -f1,2,3).0"

step.desc: On GW, will add the tunnel routes according to BR's modification
set all wired interface as access mode eth1 access br1.vpc1.vlan, eth4 access br1.vpc2.vlan
step.telnet: -v "user-profile lan1 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc1.vlan} attribute 1" -v "user-profile lan2 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc2.vlan} attribute 2" -v "interface eth1 mode bridge-access user-profile-attribute 1" -v "interface eth4 mode bridge-access user-profile-attribute 2" -v "int eth1 mac-learning enable" -v "int eth4 mac-learning enable"

step.desc: br1.vpc1 get ip addr from dhcp server of mgt0.1
set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
br1.vpc4 get ip addr from dhcp server of mgt0.2
set br1.vpc4.tif.ip var for vpc4 on BR side
bind user-profile with l3-tunnel-action all on both wifi radio and wired eth interfaces
step.telnet: -v "routing match-map mb user-profile lan1 to any" -v "routing match-map mb user-profile lan2 to any" -v "routing route-map rb via encrypted" -v "routing policy pb id 4 match-map mb route-map rb"

-v "clear log buffered" -v "_ff id 1 src-ip ${br1.vpc4.tif.ip} protocol 1 bidirectional" -v "_ff id 2 protocol 47 bidirectional" -v "_ff id 3 protocol 50 bidirectional" -v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail"
-v "clear log buffered" -v "no _ff id 1" -v "_ff id 1 src-ip ${pub.dns1.ip} protocol 1 bidirectional" -v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail"
-v "clear log buffered" -v "no _ff id 1" -v "_ff id 1 src-ip ${cvg1.vpc1.tif.ip} protocol 1 bidirectional" -v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail"
